English:
Common weapon upgrade.
Reforges a common weapon up to +4.

Mystical weapon upgrade.
Reforges a mystical weapon up to +4.

Final upgrade for all weapon types.
Reforges a weapon to its maximum level.
Returns the group to the last rested sanctuary.
Returns a dead member of the group to life.

Clay pot filled with oil.
Throwing this pot at an enemy drenches them in oil for 4 turns, reducing their fire resistance by 16%.

Clay pot filled with gunpowder.
Throwing this pot at an enemy causes flaming damage.

Clay pot filled with fulgurite powder.
Throwing this pot at an enemy causes electrical damage.

Small throwing dagger.
Throwing this dagger at an enemy causes physical damage and slight damage to posture.

Throwable curved machete.
Throwing this kukri at an enemy causes physical damage and bleeding.

Long ago, currency lost its meaning as a medium of exchange. Humanity underground found itself lost, but thanks to the cooperation of other races, they had time to stabilize and finally adopt the currency that had been used for millennia by other races.
The wisdom of intelligent races has always included the power to use herbs to heal wounds, something that in battle can be the difference between victory and death.
Many cultures worship blood, believing it to be capable of restoring the body's constitution.
This potion has been made for centuries by Yrgvonia, one of the ancient kingdoms of humanity, destroyed by the Firrelins.
Armor made of sturdy iron plates, excellent protection for physical combat.

In combat, few survive without armor, only a god of war incarnate could defeat opponents without decent armor. Impressively, many of these legends have existed and still exist, and to be able to face them is considered an unimaginable honor, a once in a lifetime chance.
Fast and powerful sword, very versatile and perfect for a dedicated warrior.
Axe scarred from so many violent clashes, implacable, almost demonic.

Warriors coming from the wars of the west keep an ancient tradition, after gaining a vast amount of experience, they must go after the Ancient Rite of the West, where through it, they gain a unique reward, which will make them more ruthless than they already are at that point.

The strength of the barbarians is so extraordinary that there is a legend that they are descendants of the ancestral Fomluds, colossally large and strong quadruped creatures from the lands of the North. Curiously, the first barbarians appeared shortly after the extinction of the Fomluds.
Increases defense by 2% for each attack dealt in battle. Maximum accumulation of 12%.
Increases attack power by 2% for each attack received in battle. Maximum accumulation of 16%.
Increases damage dealt by 20%, but increases damage taken by 15%.
Increases freezing power by 30%, but decreases resistance to fire damage by 20%.
Strengthens attacks by 30% in the first 2 turns, but reduces defense by 12% in subsequent turns.
Increases party defense by 5% per member, but decreases damage dealt by 3% per member.
Increases healing item effectiveness by 35%, but reduces maximum mana by 15%.
Increases spell power by 16%, but increases casting cost by 20%.
Strengthens attacks by 60% on enemies with full health, but weakens attacks by 40% on enemies with less than 20% health.
Poisoned enemies take 20% more damage, but they also deal 16% more damage.
Doubles the potency of healing effects, but they are divided equally among all group members.
Initiating combat by attacking deals double damage.
Grants the power to survive a deadly attack once. Restores when resting at a Jernika's Sanctuary.
Instantly counterattacks the last enemy that attacked you with your strongest weapon if the enemy's damage is greater than yours.
Grants Shards when landing a critical hit.
Passing your turn grants a 30% damage increase on your next turn.
30% chance for spells to cost only half their mana cost.
Arrow bathed in mystical oil that never stops burning.
Arrow with gunpowder stuck to its tip.
Our people lived in prosperity. There were no difficulties or wars.
Until one day, or should I say one night, everything changed.
Our cerulean starry sky began to move rapidly, and then, it seemed, to fall.
Strange beings, called Firrelins, emerged from those monstrous craters and suddenly began to attack us.
Soon, the largest, supposedly star, fell and formed the largest crater, and a proportionally gigantic creature emerged from it.
We nicknamed it Vehord, the Lupine Lord.
That monstrous wolf apparently commanded the smaller creatures. And the whole attack only got worse...
As our only choice, we hid underground on our planet.
It soon became clear that the interior of the Earth was magically indestructible to the stellar beings, but still capable of being invaded, however arduously...
Over time, exploring that new world, we were shown everything the world hid.
Magic, sophisticated engineering, other races like us, and even the gods, though most were far from their full potential or dead.
We joined forces with the other beings, and over time, we established our own societies and kingdoms.
And now, we have special troops called Moonlight Travelers, who explore the entire underground in search of resources and to improve themselves
So that, when they are together, they can cross the barrier that separates the underground from the surface and face Vehord, and any other Cerulean Lords...
So that one day, we may return to the vast kingdom that was taken from us.
But you already know that story...
